definitions: A small piece of something removed in the course of chopping, cutting, or breaking a hard material such as wood or stone.
A hole or mark on a hard object or surface where a small piece has broken off.
Wood or woody fibre split into thin strips and used for weaving hats or baskets.
A long rectangular piece of deep-fried potato.
A small chunk of sweet food (typically chocolate) added to desserts, biscuits, or snacks.
A thin slice of food (typically potato) made crisp by being fried, baked, or dried and eaten as a snack.
A tiny wafer of semiconducting material used to make an integrated circuit; a microchip.
A counter used in certain gambling games to represent money.
(in soccer, golf, and other sports) a short lofted kick or shot.
